prefix: Approach the following multiple choice question the way a physician would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following multiple choice question the way a physician would. A patient present with lower gastrointestinal bleed. Sigmoidoscopy shows ulcers inthe sigmoid. Biopsy from this area shows flask-shaped ulcers. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment -
1: Intravenous ceftriaxone
2: Intravenous metronidazole
3: Intravenous steroids and sulphasalazine
4: Hydrocoisone enemas
gpt_response: As a physician, I would choose option 3: Intravenous steroids and sulfasalazine. This treatment is typically used to manage inflammatory bowel disease, which can present with ulcers in the sigmoid colon. Steroids help reduce inflammation and sulphasalazine acts as an anti-inflammatory and immunomodulator. This treatment can help heal the ulcers and manage the lower gastrointestinal bleed.
